Description: Acne vulgaris is the formation of comedones, papules, pustules, nodules, and/or cysts as a result of obstruction and inflammation of pilosebaceous units (hair follicles and their accompanying sebaceous gland). Acne develops on the face and upper trunk. It most often affects adolescents.
Symptoms: blackheads, whiteheads, pimples, cysts, nodules
Treatments: topical creams and gels containing benzoyl peroxide or retinoids, oral medications such as antibiotics or isotretinoin, chemical peels, laser and light therapies

Description: Adenoiditis is an inflammation of the adenoids, which are small pads of tissue located in the back of the throat.
Symptoms: difficulty breathing through the nose, snoring, mouth breathing
Treatments: antibiotics, nasal decongestants, surgery to remove the adenoids

Description: Acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) is a chronic, potentially life-threatening condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). By damaging your immune system, HIV interferes with your body's ability to fight infection and disease.
Symptoms: fever, fatigue, swollen lymph nodes, rapid weight loss, frequent infections, skin rashes, night sweats, chronic diarrhea, persistent cough, memory loss, depression, neurological disorders
Treatments: antiretroviral therapy, prophylaxis for opportunistic infections, supportive care

Description: Alcoholic hepatitis is a diseased, inflammatory condition of the liver caused by heavy alcohol consumption over an extended period of time. It's also aggravated by binge drinking and ongoing alcohol use. If you develop this condition, you must stop drinking alcohol
Symptoms: vomiting,  yellowish skin,  abdominal pain,  swelling of stomach,  distention of abdomen,  history of alcohol consumption,  fluid overload
Treatments: stop alcohol consumption, consult doctor, medication, follow up

Description: An allergy is an immune system response to a foreign substance that's not typically harmful to your body.They can include certain foods, pollen, or pet dander. Your immune system's job is to keep you healthy by fighting harmful pathogens.
Symptoms: continuous sneezing,  shivering,  chills,  watering from eyes
Treatments: apply calamine, cover area with bandage, use ice to compress itching

Description: Alzheimer's disease is a progressive brain disorder that affects memory, thinking, and behavior. It is the most common cause of dementia in older adults.
Symptoms: memory loss, difficulty completing familiar tasks, language problems, disorientation, mood swings, personality changes, loss of motivation
Treatments: medications, non-drug treatments (e.g., cognitive stimulation therapy), supportive therapies, clinical trials

Description: A progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, leading to muscle weakness and eventual paralysis.
Symptoms: muscle weakness and stiffness, difficulty speaking and swallowing, muscle twitching and cramping, gradual loss of mobility, difficulty breathing
Treatments: medications to manage symptoms, physical therapy and occupational therapy, assistive devices to help with mobility and communication

Description: An anal fissure is a tear in the lining of the anus, which can cause pain and bleeding during bowel movements.
Symptoms: pain during bowel movements, bleeding from the anus, itching or burning around the anus
Treatments: stool softeners, topical analgesics, surgery in severe cases

Description: A condition in which the body lacks enough red blood cells or hemoglobin, leading to reduced oxygen supply to tissues and organs.
Symptoms: fatigue and weakness, shortness of breath, dizziness, headache, pale skin, irregular heartbeat
Treatments: supplements to increase iron or vitamin levels, blood transfusions, medications to stimulate red blood cell production

Description: Angina pectoris is a condition that causes chest pain or discomfort. It occurs when the heart muscle doesn't get enough blood and oxygen due to narrowed or blocked coronary arteries.
Symptoms: chest pain or discomfort, pain or discomfort in the arms, neck, jaw, shoulder or back, shortness of breath
Treatments: lifestyle changes such as quitting smoking, eating a healthy diet and exercising regularly, medications to relieve pain and improve blood flow to the heart, medical procedures such as angioplasty or bypass surgery

Description: Anthrax is a serious bacterial infection caused by the spore-forming bacterium Bacillus anthracis, which can affect both humans and animals.
Symptoms: flu-like symptoms, skin lesions, swelling, fever, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, nausea and vomiting, abdominal pain, headache, confusion
Treatments: antibiotics, antitoxins, wound care

Description: A group of mental health disorders characterized by excessive worry, fear, or nervousness that interferes with daily activities.
Symptoms: excessive worrying, feeling restless or on edge, irritability, difficulty concentrating, muscle tension, sleep problems, panic attacks
Treatments: therapy to learn coping strategies, medications to manage symptoms, lifestyle changes to promote relaxation and stress management

Description: Aortic stenosis is a condition that occurs when the aortic valve narrows, restricting blood flow from the heart to the rest of the body.
Symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain or discomfort, fainting or lightheadedness
Treatments: medications to manage symptoms, balloon valvuloplasty to open the narrowed valve, surgical valve replacement

Description: Aortic valve regurgitation is a condition that occurs when the aortic valve doesn't close properly, causing blood to leak back into the heart.
Symptoms: shortness of breath, fatigue, swollen ankles or feet
Treatments: medications to manage symptoms, surgical valve repair or replacement

Description: Appendicitis is a condition where the appendix becomes inflamed and swollen, usually as a result of an infection.
Symptoms: pain in the lower right side of the abdomen, nausea and vomiting, loss of appetite, fever, constipation or diarrhea
Treatments: surgery to remove the appendix, antibiotics to treat the infection, pain medication

Description: Arthritis is the swelling and tenderness of one or more of your joints. The main symptoms of arthritis are joint pain and stiffness, which typically worsen with age. The most common types of arthritis are osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Symptoms: joint pain and stiffness, swelling and redness around the joint, limited range of motion, fatigue, fever
Treatments: pain medication, anti-inflammatory drugs, physical therapy, joint replacement surgery

Description: Asthma is a chronic condition where the airways in the lungs become inflamed and narrow, making it difficult to breathe.
Symptoms: wheezing, coughing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, difficulty breathing
Treatments: bronchodilators to open up the airways, corticosteroids to reduce inflammation, leukotriene modifiers, immunomodulators

Description: Atherosclerosis is a condition where plaque builds up inside the arteries, making them narrower and restricting blood flow.
Symptoms: chest pain, shortness of breath, weakness or numbness in limbs, headache, blurry vision
Treatments: lifestyle changes such as quitting smoking and eating a healthy diet, medications to lower cholesterol and blood pressure, angioplasty or stenting to open up blocked arteries, surgery to bypass blocked arteries

Description: A neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by social, communication, and behavioral challenges that can vary widely in severity.
Symptoms: difficulty with social interactions, delayed or absent language development, repetitive behaviors or routines, narrow interests, sensory sensitivities
Treatments: behavioral therapy to teach social and communication skills, medications to manage co-occurring conditions, lifestyle changes to support overall health and well-being

Description: Autoimmune disorders refer to a group of diseases in which the immune system attacks healthy cells in the body by mistake.
Symptoms: fatigue, joint pain and swelling, skin problems, abdominal pain, digestive problems, fever, swollen glands, muscle pain
Treatments: anti-inflammatory medications, immunosuppressant drugs, corticosteroids, physical therapy, surgery (in severe cases)

Description: Avian influenza, also known as bird flu, is a highly contagious viral infection that primarily affects birds but can also infect humans.
Symptoms: fever, cough, sore throat, muscle aches, fatigue, headache, difficulty breathing, pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, multi-organ failure
Treatments: antiviral drugs, supportive care, vaccines (for birds)

Description: Bacterial meningitis is a serious infection of the meninges, which are the protective membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord.
Symptoms: fever, headache, stiff neck, nausea and vomiting, sensitivity to light, confusion, seizures, coma
Treatments: antibiotics, corticosteroids, supportive care

Description: Benign prostatic hyperplasia is a condition that causes the prostate gland to enlarge, leading to urinary problems.
Symptoms: frequent urination, difficulty starting or stopping urination, weak urine stream
Treatments: medications to relax the muscles of the prostate gland and improve urine flow, minimally invasive procedures such as transurethral microwave therapy or laser therapy, surgery to remove the prostate gland

Description: Bipolar disorder is a mental illness characterized by extreme mood swings, including episodes of mania and depression.
Symptoms: mood swings, mania (extreme high), depression (extreme low), fatigue, insomnia, irritability, difficulty concentrating, impaired judgment, risk-taking behavior
Treatments: mood stabilizing medications, antidepressants, antipsychotic medications, psychotherapy, electroconvulsive therapy (ect) (in severe cases)

Description: Blood clotting disorders refer to a group of conditions in which the blood clots too easily or doesn't clot enough, leading to an increased risk of bleeding or clotting.
Symptoms: abnormal bleeding, bruising, blood in urine or stool, swelling, pain, redness, warmth in the affected area
Treatments: blood thinners, anticoagulants, platelet inhibitors, iron supplements (in some cases)

Description: Botulism is a rare but serious bacterial infection caused by the toxin produced by the bacterium Clostridium botulinum, which can lead to paralysis and even death.
Symptoms: double vision, blurred vision, drooping eyelids, slurred speech, difficulty swallowing, dry mouth, muscle weakness, paralysis, respiratory failure
Treatments: antitoxin, ventilation support, intensive care

Description: Brain tumors refer to abnormal growths of cells in the brain that can be cancerous (malignant) or non-cancerous (benign).
Symptoms: headaches, seizures, nausea and vomiting, memory problems, changes in vision, hearing, or speech, difficulty walking or balancing, weakness or numbness on one side of the body
Treatments: surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, steroids, anti-seizure medications

Description: Breast cancer is a type of cancer that forms in the cells of the breast.
Symptoms: a lump or thickening in the breast or underarm, changes in the size or shape of the breast, nipple discharge or retraction
Treatments: surgery to remove the cancerous tissue, radiation therapy to destroy cancer cells, chemotherapy or targeted therapy to kill cancer cells

Description: Bronchial asthma is a medical condition which causes the airway path of the lungs to swell and narrow. Due to this swelling, the air path produces excess mucus making it hard to breathe, which results in coughing, short breath, and wheezing. The disease is chronic and interferes with daily working.
Symptoms: fatigue,  cough,  high fever,  breathlessness,  family history,  mucoid sputum
Treatments: switch to loose cloothing, take deep breaths, get away from trigger, seek help

Description: Bronchitis is an inflammation of the lining of the bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from the lungs.
Symptoms: persistent cough, mucus production, wheezing, shortness of breath, chest discomfort
Treatments: rest and hydration, over-the-counter cough medicine, inhaled bronchodilators, corticosteroids, antibiotics (if bacterial)

Description: Brucellosis is a bacterial infection that spreads from animals to people, usually through unpasteurized dairy products or contact with bodily fluids from infected animals.
Symptoms: fever, fatigue, loss of appetite, joint pain, muscle pain, sweating, headache
Treatments: antibiotics, rest, pain relievers

Description: Bursitis is an inflammation of the bursae, which are small sacs of fluid that cushion the joints and reduce friction between bones and soft tissues.
Symptoms: joint pain, swelling and redness, stiffness and limited range of motion
Treatments: rest and ice, anti-inflammatory medication, physical therapy

Description: Campylobacteriosis is a bacterial infection that causes diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever. It is usually contracted through contaminated food, particularly undercooked poultry.
Symptoms: diarrhea, abdominal pain, fever, nausea, vomiting
Treatments: fluids, antibiotics, rest

Description: Candidiasis is a fungal infection caused by the overgrowth of yeast. It can occur in various parts of the body, including the mouth, throat, genitals, and skin.
Symptoms: redness, itching, burning, swelling, white patches on the tongue or inside the mouth, pain during sex, discharge
Treatments: antifungal medication, topical creams, oral medication

Description: Cardiomyopathy is a disease that affects the heart muscle, making it harder for the heart to pump blood to the rest of the body.
Symptoms: shortness of breath, swelling of the legs, ankles, or feet, fatigue, irregular heartbeat
Treatments: lifestyle changes (e.g., diet, exercise), medications (e.g., ace inhibitors, beta blockers), implanted devices (e.g., pacemakers, defibrillators), surgery (e.g., heart transplant)

Description: Carotid artery disease occurs when the carotid arteries, which supply blood to the brain, become narrowed or blocked by plaque buildup.
Symptoms: transient ischemic attacks (mini-strokes), weakness or numbness on one side of the body, trouble speaking or understanding speech, dizziness
Treatments: lifestyle changes (e.g., diet, exercise), medications (e.g., blood thinners, cholesterol-lowering drugs), endarterectomy (surgical removal of plaque from artery), angioplasty and stenting (using a balloon to widen the artery and placing a stent to hold it open)

Description: Cataracts are a clouding of the eye's natural lens, which can cause blurry vision and eventually blindness if left untreated.
Symptoms: blurred or dimmed vision, difficulty seeing at night, sensitivity to light, frequent changes in eyeglass or contact lens prescription
Treatments: prescription eyeglasses or contact lenses, surgery to remove and replace the clouded lens

Description: Celiac disease is an autoimmune disorder in which the body's immune system attacks the small intestine when gluten is ingested, leading to damage and malabsorption of nutrients.
Symptoms: abdominal pain and bloating, diarrhea or constipation, fatigue, weight loss, iron-deficiency anemia
Treatments: a gluten-free diet, supplements to correct nutrient deficiencies

Description: A cerebral aneurysm is a weakened, bulging area in the wall of an artery in the brain that can rupture and cause bleeding in the brain.
Symptoms: severe headache, nausea and vomiting, stiff neck, blurred or double vision
Treatments: observation and monitoring (for small, unruptured aneurysms), endovascular coiling (placing coils in the aneurysm to block blood flow), clipping (placing a clip on the base of the aneurysm to prevent it from rupturing), surgical removal of the aneurysm

Description: Cerebral palsy is a group of disorders that affect movement and muscle tone or posture. It is caused by damage that occurs to the immature brain as it develops, most often before birth.
Symptoms: muscle stiffness, muscle weakness, lack of muscle coordination, tremors, difficulty with fine motor skills, difficulty with gross motor skills, difficulty with swallowing or speaking
Treatments: physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, medications for muscle spasticity or seizures, surgery in some cases

Description: Cervical cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the cells of the cervix, which is the lower part of the uterus that connects to the vagina.
Symptoms: abnormal vaginal bleeding, pain during sex, pelvic pain, unusual vaginal discharge
Treatments: surgery (e.g., hysterectomy, removal of lymph nodes), radiation therapy, chemotherapy, targeted therapy

Description: Cervical spondylosis is a general term for age-related wear and tear affecting the spinal disks in your neck. As the disks dehydrate and shrink, signs of osteoarthritis develop, including bony projections along the edges of bones (bone spurs).
Symptoms: back pain,  weakness in limbs,  neck pain,  dizziness,  loss of balance
Treatments: use heating pad or cold pack, exercise, take otc pain reliver, consult doctor

Description: Chagas disease is a parasitic infection caused by the protozoan Trypanosoma cruzi. It is primarily found in Latin America, where it is transmitted to humans through the bite of infected triatomine bugs.
Symptoms: fever, fatigue, body aches, swollen lymph nodes, headache, enlarged liver or spleen, heart palpitations
Treatments: antiparasitic medication, symptomatic treatment

Description: Chickenpox is a highly contagious disease caused by the varicella-zoster virus (VZV). It can cause an itchy, blister-like rash. The rash first appears on the chest, back, and face, and then spreads over the entire body, causing between 250 and 500 itchy blisters.
Symptoms: itching,  skin rash,  fatigue,  lethargy,  high fever,  headache,  loss of appetite,  mild fever,  swelled lymph nodes,  malaise,  red spots over body
Treatments: use neem in bathing , consume neem leaves, take vaccine, avoid public places

Description: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection that causes an itchy rash and blisters. It is primarily spread through direct contact with an infected person or through airborne transmission.
Symptoms: fever, fatigue, loss of appetite, headache, itchy rash, blisters, body aches
Treatments: antiviral medication, symptomatic treatment

Description: A common sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Chlamydia trachomatis.
Symptoms: painful urination, abnormal vaginal discharge, pain during sex
Treatments: antibiotics, pain relievers, abstaining from sexual activity

Description: Cholecystitis is an inflammation of the gallbladder, which is a small organ located near the liver that stores bile.
Symptoms: abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting, fever and chills
Treatments: antibiotics, pain medication, surgery to remove the gallbladder in severe cases

Description: An acute diarrheal illness caused by the bacterium Vibrio cholerae.
Symptoms: profuse watery diarrhea, vomiting, dehydration
Treatments: rehydration therapy, antibiotics, zinc supplements

Description: Chronic bronchitis is a type of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) that causes inflammation and narrowing of the airways in the lungs.
Symptoms: persistent cough, shortness of breath, chest tightness
Treatments: bronchodilators, corticosteroids, oxygen therapy in severe cases

Description: Chronic cholestatic diseases, whether occurring in infancy, childhood or adulthood, are characterized by defective bile acid transport from the liver to the intestine, which is caused by primary damage to the biliary epithelium in most cases
Symptoms: itching,  vomiting,  yellowish skin,  nausea,  loss of appetite,  abdominal pain,  yellowing of eyes
Treatments: cold baths, anti itch medicine, consult doctor, eat healthy

Description: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) is a condition characterized by a gradual loss of kidney function over time. It can lead to kidney failure if left untreated.
Symptoms: fatigue, weakness, loss of appetite, swelling in the legs, difficulty sleeping, changes in urination (e.g., frequency, color, or smell)
Treatments: medications to control blood pressure and cholesterol levels, dietary changes to manage potassium, sodium, and protein intake, dialysis or kidney transplant in severe cases

Description: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a chronic lung disease characterized by obstruction of airflow from the lungs, making it difficult to breathe.
Symptoms: shortness of breath, especially during physical activities, wheezing, chest tightness, chronic cough, frequent respiratory infections, lack of energy, unintended weight loss
Treatments: smoking cessation, bronchodilators to relax the muscles around the airways, inhaled corticosteroids to reduce inflammation, pulmonary rehabilitation to improve lung function and overall fitness, supplemental oxygen therapy, surgery in severe cases

Description: Cirrhosis is a late stage of liver disease in which healthy liver tissue is replaced with scar tissue, impairing liver function and leading to a range of symptoms.
Symptoms: fatigue and weakness, loss of appetite and weight loss, nausea and vomiting, abdominal swelling and pain, jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes)
Treatments: treatment of underlying causes (e.g., alcohol cessation, hepatitis treatment), medications to manage symptoms, liver transplant in severe cases

Description: Cirrhosis is a late stage of scarring of the liver caused by long-term liver damage. It can lead to liver failure and other complications such as bleeding, infections, and liver cancer.
Symptoms: fatigue, weakness, loss of appetite, nausea and vomiting, abdominal pain and swelling, jaundice, itchy skin, easy bruising and bleeding, spider-like blood vessels on the skin
Treatments: medications to manage complications, dietary changes to limit salt and fluid intake, alcohol abstinence, liver transplant

Description: A fungal infection caused by inhaling spores of the Coccidioides fungus.
Symptoms: cough, fever, chest pain
Treatments: antifungal medications, rest, pain relievers

Description: Colitis is an inflammation of the colon, which can cause a range of symptoms depending on the underlying cause.
Symptoms: abdominal pain and cramping, diarrhea or constipation, rectal bleeding, urgent bowel movements, fever and fatigue
Treatments: anti-inflammatory medications, immunosuppressants, surgery to remove the colon in severe cases

Description: Colorectal cancer is a type of cancer that affects the colon and/or rectum. It often starts as a polyp, which can eventually become cancerous if left untreated.
Symptoms: abdominal pain, blood in the stool, changes in bowel habits (e.g., diarrhea or constipation), unintended weight loss, fatigue
Treatments: surgery to remove the cancerous tissue, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, immunotherapy

Description: The common cold is a viral infection of your nose and throat (upper respiratory tract). It's usually harmless, although it might not feel that way. Many types of viruses can cause a common cold.
Symptoms: runny nose, sore throat, cough
Treatments: rest, fluids, over-the-counter medications for symptom relief

Description: Congenital heart defects are abnormalities in the heart's structure that are present at birth. They can affect the heart's valves, chambers, or blood vessels.
Symptoms: blue or gray skin color, shortness of breath, fatigue, swelling in the legs, abdomen, or areas around the eyes, delayed growth and development (in infants and children)
Treatments: surgery to repair the heart defect, medications to control symptoms, heart transplant in severe cases

Description: Congestive heart failure occurs when the heart is unable to pump enough blood to meet the body's needs. It can lead to symptoms such as shortness of breath, fatigue, and swelling in the legs and ankles.
Symptoms: shortness of breath, fatigue, swelling in the legs, ankles, or feet, rapid or irregular heartbeat, chest pain, persistent cough or wheezing, lack of appetite, confusion or impaired thinking
Treatments: medications to manage symptoms and improve heart function, lifestyle changes such as diet and exercise, implantation of devices such as pacemakers or defibrillators, heart transplant

Description: Conjunctivitis, also known as pink eye, is an inflammation of the conjunctiva, which is the thin, clear tissue that lines the inside of the eyelid and covers the white part of the eye.
Symptoms: redness in the white of the eye or inner eyelid, increased amount of tears, thick yellow discharge that crusts over the eyelashes, especially after sleep, itchy or burning eyes, blurred vision, sensitivity to light
Treatments: artificial tears, antihistamine eye drops, topical corticosteroids, cold compresses, warm compresses

Description: Coronary artery disease is a condition in which the arteries that supply blood to the heart become narrowed or blocked due to plaque buildup.
Symptoms: chest pain or discomfort, shortness of breath, heart palpitations, nausea, sweating
Treatments: lifestyle changes such as a healthy diet and exercise, medications such as aspirin and statins, procedures such as angioplasty or bypass surgery

Description: COVID-19 is the disease caused by a new coronavirus called SARS-CoV-2. It is a kind of virus that causes an infection in your nose, sinuses, or upper throat. The most recently discovered coronavirus causes coronavirus disease COVID-19.
Symptoms: fever, dry cough, fatigue, loss of taste or smell, nasal congestion, conjunctivitis (also known as red eyes), sore throat, headache, muscle or joint pain, different types of skin rash, nausea or vomiting, diarrhea, chills or dizziness
Treatments: getting enough rest, staying well hydrated, and taking medications to relieve fever and aches and pains., communication with a treating physician and promptly report in case of any worsening., fda approved medicines like remdesivir, paxlovid, molnupiravir, tocilizumab

Description: A rare and fatal brain disorder caused by prions, abnormal proteins that damage brain cells.
Symptoms: rapidly progressive dementia, muscle stiffness, difficulty with coordination and movement
Treatments: there is no cure or treatment that can slow the progression of the disease

Description: Crohn's disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract from mouth to anus. Symptoms include abdominal pain, diarrhea, and weight loss.
Symptoms: abdominal pain and cramping, diarrhea, blood in your stool, reduced appetite and weight loss, fatigue, fever
Treatments: anti-inflammatory drugs, immune system suppressors, antibiotics, nutrition therapy, surgery

Description: Cryptococcosis is a fungal infection caused by Cryptococcus neoformans or Cryptococcus gattii. It can affect the lungs, brain, and other parts of the body.
Symptoms: fever, headache, nausea and vomiting, stiff neck, sensitivity to light, confusion, shortness of breath
Treatments: antifungal medications, amphotericin b, flucytosine, fluconazole

Description: Cryptosporidiosis is a parasitic infection caused by the Cryptosporidium parasite. It can cause diarrhea, stomach cramps, nausea, and vomiting.
Symptoms: diarrhea, stomach cramps, nausea, vomiting, fever, dehydration
Treatments: antiparasitic medications, nitazoxanide, azithromycin, rehydration therapy

Description: Cystic fibrosis is an inherited disorder that causes severe damage to the lungs, digestive system and other organs in the body. It affects the cells that produce mucus, sweat and digestive juices.
Symptoms: persistent cough with thick mucus, wheezing or shortness of breath, poor growth or weight gain, frequent respiratory infections, salty-tasting skin, difficulty with bowel movements
Treatments: airway clearance techniques, inhaled medications, oral pancreatic enzyme supplements, antibiotics, nutrition therapy

Description: Cytomegalovirus (CMV) is a common virus that can infect people of all ages. Most people with CMV have no symptoms, but it can cause serious problems in people with weakened immune systems.
Symptoms: fever, fatigue, sore throat, swollen glands, muscle aches, loss of appetite, jaundice, pneumonia, encephalitis
Treatments: antiviral medications, ganciclovir, valganciclovir, foscarnet

Description: Deep vein thrombosis is a blood clot that forms in a vein deep inside the body, usually in the leg.
Symptoms: swelling in the affected leg, pain or tenderness in the affected leg, warmth in the skin over the affected leg, red or discolored skin over the affected leg, shortness of breath
Treatments: anticoagulant medications to prevent the clot from getting bigger, thrombolytic therapy to dissolve the clot, compression stockings or devices to help prevent swelling and blood clots

Description: Dementia is a general term for a decline in mental ability severe enough to interfere with daily life. Memory loss is an example. Alzheimer's is the most common type of dementia.
Symptoms: memory loss, difficulty communicating, inability to focus or pay attention, poor reasoning or judgment, confusion and disorientation, mood changes
Treatments: medications to treat cognitive symptoms, antidepressants, antipsychotics, occupational therapy, speech therapy

Description: an acute infectious disease caused by a flavivirus (species Dengue virus of the genus Flavivirus), transmitted by aedes mosquitoes, and characterized by headache, severe joint pain, and a rash. â€” called also breakbone fever, dengue fever.
Symptoms: skin rash,  chills,  joint pain,  vomiting,  fatigue,  high fever,  headache,  nausea,  loss of appetite,  pain behind the eyes,  back pain,  muscle pain,  red spots over body
Treatments: drink papaya leaf juice, avoid fatty spicy food, keep mosquitos away, keep hydrated

Description: Dengue fever is a viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes. It can cause a high fever, severe headache, joint and muscle pain, and a rash.
Symptoms: high fever, severe headache, joint and muscle pain, nausea and vomiting, rash, pain behind the eyes, fatigue
Treatments: pain relievers, fluid replacement therapy, rest, preventing dehydration

Description: Dental caries, also known as tooth decay, is a common dental problem caused by the breakdown of tooth enamel by bacteria. It can lead to pain, infection, and tooth loss if left untreated.
Symptoms: toothache or pain when eating or drinking, sensitivity to hot or cold temperatures, visible holes or pits in the teeth, dark spots on the teeth, bad breath or a bad taste in the mouth
Treatments: fillings to repair cavities, crowns to cover damaged teeth, root canal therapy to treat infections, tooth extraction in severe cases

Description: Depression is a mood disorder that can affect a person's thoughts, feelings, and behaviors. It can lead to feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and loss of interest in daily activities.
Symptoms: persistent feelings of sadness, anxiety, or emptiness, loss of interest in activities that were once enjoyable, difficulty sleeping or oversleeping, changes in appetite or weight, fatigue, difficulty concentrating or making decisions
Treatments: antidepressant medications, psychotherapy, brain stimulation therapies (e.g., electroconvulsive therapy or transcranial magnetic stimulation)

Description: Diabetes is a disease that occurs when your blood glucose, also called blood sugar, is too high. Blood glucose is your main source of energy and comes from the food you eat. Insulin, a hormone made by the pancreas, helps glucose from food get into your cells to be used for energy.
Symptoms: fatigue,  weight loss,  restlessness,  lethargy,  irregular sugar level,  blurred and distorted vision,  obesity,  excessive hunger,  increased appetite,  polyuria
Treatments: have balanced diet, exercise, consult doctor, follow up

Description: Diabetes mellitus is a chronic metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels due to the body's inability to produce or use insulin effectively.
Symptoms: increased thirst, frequent urination, extreme hunger, unexplained weight loss, fatigue, blurred vision, slow-healing sores or frequent infections, tingling or numbness in the hands or feet, dry, itchy skin
Treatments: lifestyle changes (e.g. diet, exercise), oral medications (e.g. metformin, sulfonylureas), insulin therapy, blood sugar monitoring, regular check-ups with a healthcare provider

Description: Hemorrhoids, also spelled haemorrhoids, are vascular structures in the anal canal.
Symptoms: constipation,  pain during bowel movements,  pain in anal region,  bloody stool,  irritation in anus
Treatments: avoid fatty spicy food, consume witch hazel, warm bath with epsom salt, consume alovera juice

Description: Diphtheria is a bacterial infection that can cause severe respiratory and cardiac problems. It is spread through contact with an infected person or object.
Symptoms: sore throat, fever, swollen glands in the neck, weakness and fatigue, difficulty breathing, nasal discharge, formation of a thick grayish coating in the throat and nose
Treatments: antibiotics, diphtheria antitoxin, supportive care

Description: Diverticulitis is a condition in which small pouches that form in the wall of the colon become infected or inflamed.
Symptoms: abdominal pain, usually on the left side, fever, nausea, vomiting, constipation or diarrhea
Treatments: antibiotics to treat the infection, liquid diet or low-fiber diet to help the colon rest, surgery to remove the affected part of the colon in severe cases

Description: Down Syndrome is a genetic disorder that causes developmental and intellectual delays, as well as physical characteristics such as low muscle tone, upward slanting eyes, and a flat nasal bridge.
Symptoms: intellectual disability, delayed developmental milestones, hypotonia (low muscle tone), upward slanting eyes, flat nasal bridge, short stature, heart defects
Treatments: early intervention and special education, speech and physical therapy, treatment of associated health issues

Description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) is an injury caused by taking medication. ADRs may occur following a single dose or prolonged administration of a drug or result from the combination of two or more drugs.
Symptoms: itching,  skin rash,  stomach pain,  burning micturition,  spotting  urination
Treatments: stop irritation, consult nearest hospital, stop taking drug, follow up

Description: E. coli infection is a type of foodborne illness caused by consuming food or water contaminated with the bacteria E. coli.
Symptoms: abdominal pain, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, fatigue, fever, bloody stool
Treatments: supportive care, fluid replacement

Description: Ebola virus disease (EVD) is a rare but severe illness caused by the Ebola virus.
Symptoms: fever, headache, muscle pain, fatigue, diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal pain, unexplained hemorrhage
Treatments: supportive care, experimental treatments

Description: Eczema is a chronic skin condition characterized by itchy, inflamed patches of skin. The cause of eczema is unknown, but it is thought to be related to an overactive immune system and a defective skin barrier.
Symptoms: itchy, red, and dry skin, thickened, cracked, or scaly skin, small bumps that may leak fluid, sensitive skin, discoloration of the skin
Treatments: moisturizers and topical steroids, avoiding triggers (such as certain fabrics, soaps, or foods), antihistamines for itching, immunosuppressants for severe cases

Description: Ehrlichiosis is a bacterial illness transmitted by ticks that causes flu-like symptoms.
Symptoms: fever, headache, muscle aches, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, cough, joint pain, confusion
Treatments: doxycycline, other antibiotics

Description: Emphysema is a lung disease that damages the air sacs in the lungs. This damage makes it harder to breathe and can lead to shortness of breath, coughing, and wheezing.
Symptoms: shortness of breath, especially during physical activities, wheezing, chest tightness, chronic cough, lack of energy
Treatments: quitting smoking, medications such as bronchodilators, inhaled steroids, or oxygen therapy, pulmonary rehabilitation, lung volume reduction surgery, lung transplant

Description: Encephalitis is inflammation of the brain, usually caused by a viral infection.
Symptoms: fever, headache, stiff neck, confusion, seizures, muscle weakness, personality changes, loss of consciousness
Treatments: antiviral medications, steroids, supportive care

Description: Endocarditis is an infection of the lining of the heart or heart valves.
Symptoms: fever, fatigue, shortness of breath, swelling in the legs, feet, or abdomen, heart murmur
Treatments: antibiotics to treat the infection, surgery to repair or replace damaged heart valves, anticoagulant medications to prevent blood clots

Description: Endometriosis is a condition where the tissue that normally lines the inside of the uterus grows outside of it, leading to pain and discomfort.
Symptoms: painful periods, pain during intercourse, painful bowel movements or urination during menstruation, excessive bleeding, infertility
Treatments: pain relievers such as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (nsaids), hormone therapy, surgery to remove endometrial tissue, assisted reproductive technologies (art)

Description: Enterovirus infection is a viral illness that can cause a range of symptoms from mild to severe.
Symptoms: fever, headache, muscle aches, fatigue, rash, sore throat, runny nose, cough, diarrhea, vomiting, meningitis, encephalitis
Treatments: supportive care, antiviral medications, pain and fever relief

Description: Epilepsy is a neurological disorder that causes seizures, which can range from mild to severe and affect different parts of the brain.
Symptoms: seizures, temporary confusion, staring spells, loss of consciousness, psychic symptoms
Treatments: antiepileptic drugs (aeds), surgery to remove the part of the brain causing seizures, vagus nerve stimulation (vns), ketogenic diet

Description: Erectile dysfunction is the inability to get or maintain an erection firm enough for sexual intercourse.
Symptoms: difficulty getting an erection, difficulty maintaining an erection, reduced sexual desire
Treatments: oral medications such as sildenafil (viagra), tadalafil (cialis), or vardenafil (levitra), injections into the penis, penile implants

Description: Erysipelas is a bacterial skin infection that usually affects the legs, but can also occur on the face, arms and other parts of the body. It is caused by group A streptococcus bacteria and is characterized by redness, warmth, and swelling of the affected area.
Symptoms: redness, warmth, and swelling of the skin, fever, chills, fatigue, pain and tenderness in the affected area, blisters and sores may develop
Treatments: antibiotics, such as penicillin or erythromycin, pain relievers, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen, elevating the affected limb to reduce swelling, resting and staying hydrated

Description: Escherichia coli O157:H7 is a strain of E. coli bacteria that can cause severe foodborne illness. It is typically spread through contaminated food or water and can lead to symptoms such as abdominal pain, diarrhea, and dehydration. In severe cases, it can cause kidney failure and other complications.
Symptoms: abdominal pain and cramping, diarrhea, often bloody, nausea and vomiting, dehydration, fever, fatigue
Treatments: drinking plenty of fluids to prevent dehydration, antibiotics are not recommended for treating e. coli o157:h7 infection as they can increase the risk of kidney damage, in severe cases, hospitalization may be necessary

Description: Esophageal cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the cells that line the esophagus.
Symptoms: difficulty swallowing, unintentional weight loss, chest pain or discomfort, heartburn or indigestion, chronic cough
Treatments: surgery to remove the cancer, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, palliative care to manage symptoms in advanced cases

Description: Fibromyalgia is a chronic condition that causes widespread pain and tenderness in the body, as well as fatigue, sleep disturbances, and cognitive difficulties.
Symptoms: widespread pain, tender points, fatigue, sleep disturbances, cognitive difficulties
Treatments: pain relievers such as acetaminophen, nsaids, or opioids, antidepressants, anticonvulsants, physical therapy, counseling

Description: Filariasis is a parasitic infection that is transmitted by mosquitoes. It can lead to a variety of symptoms, including fever, lymphedema, and elephantiasis. The infection is common in many tropical and subtropical regions of the world.
Symptoms: swelling of the limbs, genitalia, or breasts, fever, chills, muscle and joint pain, fatigue, skin rash, lymphedema
Treatments: antiparasitic medication, such as diethylcarbamazine, symptomatic treatment, such as pain relievers or antibiotics to treat secondary infections, preventive measures, such as mosquito control measures and the use of bed nets

Description: In humans, fungal infections occur when an invading fungus takes over an area of the body and is too much for the immune system to handle. Fungi can live in the air, soil, water, and plants. There are also some fungi that live naturally in the human body. Like many microbes, there are helpful fungi and harmful fungi.
Symptoms: itching,  skin rash,  nodal skin eruptions,  dischromic  patches
Treatments: bath twice, use detol or neem in bathing water, keep infected area dry, use clean cloths

Description: Gallbladder cancer is a cancerous growth in the gallbladder, a small organ located beneath the liver that stores bile.
Symptoms: abdominal pain, jaundice, nausea and vomiting, loss of appetite, weight loss
Treatments: surgery to remove the gallbladder, chemotherapy, radiation therapy

Description: Gallstones are hardened deposits of digestive fluid that can form in the gallbladder, causing pain and other complications.
Symptoms: sudden and rapidly intensifying pain in the upper right portion of your abdomen, pain in the back between the shoulder blades, pain in the right shoulder, nausea, vomiting
Treatments: surgery to remove the gallbladder (cholecystectomy), medications to dissolve gallstones, lithotripsy

Description: Inflammation of the stomach lining
Symptoms: abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting
Treatments: antacids, proton pump inhibitors, dietary changes

Description: Gastroenteritis is an inflammation of the digestive tract, particularly the stomach, and large and small intestines. Viral and bacterial gastroenteritis are intestinal infections associated with symptoms of diarrhea , abdominal cramps, nausea , and vomiting .
Symptoms: vomiting,  sunken eyes,  dehydration,  diarrhoea
Treatments: stop eating solid food for while, try taking small sips of water, rest, ease back into eating

Description: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) is a chronic condition in which acid reflux occurs more than twice a week, causing inflammation and irritation of the esophagus.
Symptoms: heartburn, regurgitation, difficulty swallowing, chest pain
Treatments: antacids, proton pump inhibitors, h2 blockers, lifestyle changes (e.g., weight loss, avoiding trigger foods)

Description: Gastroesophageal reflux disease, or GERD, is a digestive disorder that affects the lower esophageal sphincter (LES), the ring of muscle between the esophagus and stomach. Many people, including pregnant women, suffer from heartburn or acid indigestion caused by GERD.
Symptoms: stomach pain,  acidity,  ulcers on tongue,  vomiting,  cough,  chest pain
Treatments: avoid fatty spicy food, avoid lying down after eating, maintain healthy weight, exercise

Description: Giardiasis is a diarrheal illness caused by the microscopic parasite Giardia.
Symptoms: diarrhea, abdominal cramps, bloating, nausea, fatigue, loss of appetite, weight loss
Treatments: antibiotics, anti-diarrheal medications, rehydration therapy

Description: Damage to the optic nerve that can lead to vision loss
Symptoms: blurred vision, eye pain, headaches
Treatments: eye drops, laser surgery, trabeculectomy

Description: Glomerulonephritis is a type of kidney disease in which the tiny filters in the kidneys become inflamed and damaged, leading to kidney failure.
Symptoms: blood in the urine, foamy urine, swelling in the face, hands, or feet, high blood pressure
Treatments: medications to control blood pressure and reduce inflammation, dialysis, kidney transplant

Description: Gonorrhea is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Neisseria gonorrhoeae.
Symptoms: painful urination, abnormal discharge, painful intercourse, lower abdominal pain, fever
Treatments: antibiotics, pain relief medication, rest, safe sex practices

Description: A type of arthritis caused by a buildup of uric acid crystals in the joints
Symptoms: intense joint pain, swelling, redness
Treatments: nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (nsaids), colchicine, urate-lowering therapy

Description: Graves' disease is an autoimmune disorder that causes hyperthyroidism, or overactive thyroid.
Symptoms: anxiety and irritability, weight loss, rapid or irregular heartbeat
Treatments: anti-thyroid medication such as methimazole or propylthiouracil, radioactive iodine therapy, surgery to remove the thyroid gland

Description: Group A streptococcal infection is a bacterial infection caused by group A streptococcus.
Symptoms: fever, sore throat, swollen lymph nodes, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, rash
Treatments: antibiotics, pain relief medication, rest

Description: Haemophilus influenzae infection is a bacterial infection caused by Haemophilus influenzae.
Symptoms: fever, headache, stiff neck, fatigue, ear pain, difficulty breathing
Treatments: antibiotics, pain relief medication, rest

Description: Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome is a rare but serious respiratory disease caused by hantavirus.
Symptoms: fever, muscle aches, fatigue, shortness of breath, cough, headaches, abdominal pain
Treatments: hospitalization, oxygen therapy, fluid replacement therapy

Description: Hashimoto's thyroiditis is an autoimmune disorder that causes hypothyroidism, or underactive thyroid.
Symptoms: fatigue and sluggishness, weight gain, depression
Treatments: synthetic thyroid hormone replacement therapy, lifestyle changes such as a healthy diet and exercise, avoiding certain foods such as soy and high-fiber foods

Description: Hearing loss is the partial or total inability to hear sounds.
Symptoms: difficulty hearing conversations, muffling of speech and other sounds, ringing in the ears
Treatments: hearing aids, cochlear implants, assistive listening devices

Description: The death of heart muscle due to the loss of blood supply. The loss of blood supply is usually caused by a complete blockage of a coronary artery, one of the arteries that supplies blood to the heart muscle.
Symptoms: chest pain or discomfort, upper body pain or discomfort in the arms, back, neck, jaw, or stomach, shortness of breath, nausea or vomiting, lightheadedness, dizziness, or fainting, sweating
Treatments: aspirin, thrombolytics (clot-busting drugs), antiplatelet drugs, coronary angioplasty and stenting, coronary artery bypass surgery

Description: Heart failure is a chronic condition in which the heart is unable to pump enough blood to meet the body's needs.
Symptoms: shortness of breath, fatigue, swelling in the legs, ankles, or feet, coughing or wheezing, rapid or irregular heartbeat
Treatments: medications to improve heart function and control symptoms, lifestyle changes (e.g., reducing salt intake, exercising regularly), surgery (e.g., implanting a pacemaker, heart transplant)

Description: Helminthiasis is a parasitic disease caused by helminths.
Symptoms: abdominal pain, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, fever, fatigue, weight loss
Treatments: antiparasitic medications, surgery (in some cases)

Description: Hemophilia is a genetic disorder that affects the body's ability to clot blood, leading to excessive bleeding and easy bruising.
Symptoms: excessive bleeding, frequent nosebleeds, blood in the urine or stool
Treatments: replacement therapy with clotting factors, desmopressin to increase the levels of clotting factors, gene therapy

Description: Swollen veins in the anus and lower rectum
Symptoms: bleeding, pain or discomfort, itching
Treatments: over-the-counter creams or ointments, sitz baths, surgery

Description: Hepatitis A is a highly contagious liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus. The virus is one of several types of hepatitis viruses that cause inflammation and affect your liver's ability to function.
Symptoms: fatigue, nausea and vomiting, abdominal pain, loss of appetite, dark urine, joint pain, jaundice
Treatments: rest, adequate nutrition, fluids, vaccination

Description: Hepatitis B is an infection of your liver. It can cause scarring of the organ, liver failure, and cancer. It can be fatal if it isn't treated. It's spread when people come in contact with the blood, open sores, or body fluids of someone who has the hepatitis B virus.
Symptoms: fever, fatigue, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, joint pain, jaundice
Treatments: antiviral medication, rest, adequate nutrition, fluids, vaccination

Description: Inflammation of the liver due to the hepatitis C virus (HCV), which is usually spread via blood transfusion (rare), hemodialysis, and needle sticks. The damage hepatitis C does to the liver can lead to cirrhosis and its complications as well as cancer.
Symptoms: fever, fatigue, joint pain, muscle pain, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, dark urine, jaundice
Treatments: antiviral medication, rest, adequate nutrition, fluids

Description: Hepatitis D, also known as the hepatitis delta virus, is an infection that causes the liver to become inflamed. This swelling can impair liver function and cause long-term liver problems, including liver scarring and cancer. The condition is caused by the hepatitis D virus (HDV).
Symptoms: joint pain,  vomiting,  fatigue,  yellowish skin,  dark urine,  nausea,  loss of appetite,  abdominal pain,  yellowing of eyes
Treatments: consult doctor, medication, eat healthy, follow up

Description: A rare form of liver inflammation caused by infection with the hepatitis E virus (HEV). It is transmitted via food or drink handled by an infected person or through infected water supplies in areas where fecal matter may get into the water. Hepatitis E does not cause chronic liver disease.
Symptoms: joint pain,  vomiting,  fatigue,  high fever,  yellowish skin,  dark urine,  nausea,  loss of appetite,  abdominal pain,  yellowing of eyes,  coma,  stomach bleeding
Treatments: stop alcohol consumption, rest, consult doctor, medication

Description: A bulge or protrusion of an organ or tissue through an abnormal opening in the abdominal wall
Symptoms: a visible bulge, pain or discomfort, nausea or vomiting
Treatments: watchful waiting, hernia truss, surgery

Description: Herpes zoster, also known as shingles, is a viral infection that causes a painful rash.
Symptoms: pain, burning, or tingling on one side of the body, a rash that appears as a band or stripe on one side of the body, blisters that break open and crust over, itching, fever, headache, sensitivity to light
Treatments: antiviral medication, pain relievers, topical creams or gels, cool, wet compresses, rest

Description: Hiatal hernia is a condition in which a portion of the stomach protrudes upward into the chest, through an opening in the diaphragm.
Symptoms: heartburn, acid reflux, difficulty swallowing, chest or abdominal pain, shortness of breath
Treatments: antacids, medications to reduce acid production, surgery (in severe cases)

Description: High blood pressure is a common condition in which the force of blood against your artery walls is consistently too high, which can eventually cause health problems, such as heart disease.
Symptoms: headaches, shortness of breath, nosebleeds, flushed face, dizziness, chest pain, visual changes
Treatments: lifestyle changes (e.g., healthy diet, regular exercise, stress management), medications (e.g., ace inhibitors, diuretics, beta blockers), monitoring blood pressure regularly

Description: High cholesterol is a condition in which you have too much cholesterol â€” a waxy, fat-like substance â€” in your blood. High cholesterol can increase your risk of heart disease and other health problems.
Symptoms: none (usually asymptomatic), yellowish patches around the eyes, xanthomas (fatty deposits) on the elbows, knees, and tendons
Treatments: lifestyle changes (e.g., healthy diet, regular exercise, quitting smoking), medications (e.g., statins, bile acid sequestrants, niacin), monitoring cholesterol levels regularly

Description: Histoplasmosis is a fungal infection caused by inhaling spores of the fungus Histoplasma capsulatum. It can cause flu-like symptoms and can be severe in people with weakened immune systems.
Symptoms: fever, cough, chest pain, fatigue, body aches
Treatments: antifungal medications, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids

Description: Hodgkin's lymphoma is a cancer of the lymphatic system, which is part of the body's immune system.
Symptoms: enlarged lymph nodes, fever, night sweats, unexplained weight loss
Treatments: chemotherapy, radiation therapy, stem cell transplant

Description: Hookworm infection is caused by parasitic worms that live in the intestines. It is commonly found in areas with poor sanitation and can lead to anemia and malnutrition.
Symptoms: itching and a rash at the site of infection, abdominal pain, diarrhea, fatigue, loss of appetite
Treatments: anthelmintic medications, iron supplements, intravenous fluids

Description: Human papillomavirus (HPV) is a viral infection that can cause genital warts and increase the risk of developing certain cancers, including cervical cancer.
Symptoms: genital warts, abnormal pap test results, no symptoms in many cases
Treatments: medications to treat warts, surgery to remove abnormal tissue, vaccines to prevent infection

Description: Huntington's disease is a genetic disorder that causes the progressive breakdown of nerve cells in the brain, which leads to mental and physical disabilities.
Symptoms: difficulty concentrating and remembering things, depression and anxiety, uncontrolled movements (chorea), difficulty with coordination and balance, difficulty with speech and swallowing
Treatments: medications to control movement and psychiatric symptoms, physical therapy to maintain mobility and prevent falls, speech therapy to improve communication and swallowing

Description: Hypertension (HTN or HT), also known as high blood pressure (HBP), is a long-term medical condition in which the blood pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated. High blood pressure typically does not cause symptoms.
Symptoms: headache,  chest pain,  dizziness,  loss of balance,  lack of concentration
Treatments: meditation, salt baths, reduce stress, get proper sleep

Description: Hyperthyroidism (overactive thyroid) occurs when your thyroid gland produces too much of the hormone thyroxine. Hyperthyroidism can accelerate your body's metabolism, causing unintentional weight loss and a rapid or irregular heartbeat.
Symptoms: weight loss, increased appetite, nervousness or anxiety, tremors, sweating, heat sensitivity, fatigue, muscle weakness, difficulty sleeping
Treatments: antithyroid medication, radioactive iodine therapy, beta blockers

Description: Hypoglycemia is a condition in which your blood sugar (glucose) level is lower than normal. Glucose is your body's main energy source. Hypoglycemia is often related to diabetes treatment. But other drugs and a variety of conditions â€” many rare â€” can cause low blood sugar in people who don't have diabetes.
Symptoms: vomiting,  fatigue,  anxiety,  sweating,  headache,  nausea,  blurred and distorted vision,  excessive hunger,  slurred speech,  irritability,  palpitations
Treatments: lie down on side, check in pulse, drink sugary drinks, consult doctor

Description: Hypothyroidism, also called underactive thyroid or low thyroid, is a disorder of the endocrine system in which the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormone.
Symptoms: fatigue, weight gain, cold intolerance, dry skin, hair loss, constipation, depression, muscle weakness, joint pain
Treatments: levothyroxine (thyroid hormone replacement therapy)

Description: Impetigo (im-puh-TIE-go) is a common and highly contagious skin infection that mainly affects infants and children. Impetigo usually appears as red sores on the face, especially around a child's nose and mouth, and on hands and feet. The sores burst and develop honey-colored crusts.
Symptoms: red sores that quickly turn into blisters, fluid-filled blisters that burst and develop honey-colored crusts, itching
Treatments: antibiotic ointments or creams, oral antibiotics, keeping the affected area clean and covered

Description: Infectious mononucleosis, also known as mono or glandular fever, is a viral infection that causes fever, sore throat, and swollen lymph nodes.
Symptoms: fatigue, fever, sore throat, swollen lymph nodes, headache, muscle aches, rash
Treatments: rest, pain relievers, drinking fluids, steroids (in severe cases)

Description: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is a group of chronic conditions that cause inflammation in the digestive tract.
Symptoms: abdominal pain, diarrhea, rectal bleeding, fatigue, weight loss
Treatments: medications to reduce inflammation, immunosuppressants, surgery (in severe cases)

Description: Influenza, commonly known as the flu, is a viral infection that affects the respiratory system.
Symptoms: fever, cough, sore throat, runny or stuffy nose, body aches, headache, fatigue
Treatments: rest, drinking fluids, pain relievers, antiviral medication (in some cases)

Description: Insomnia is a sleep disorder that makes it difficult to fall asleep or stay asleep.
Symptoms: difficulty falling asleep, difficulty staying asleep, waking up too early, daytime fatigue, difficulty concentrating
Treatments: improving sleep habits, medications, cognitive behavioral therapy

Description: Interstitial cystitis (IC) is a chronic condition that causes bladder pain and discomfort.
Symptoms: pelvic pain, frequent urination, urgency to urinate, painful urination, pain during sexual intercourse
Treatments: bladder distention (stretching), medications to relieve bladder pain, physical therapy, nerve stimulation

Description: Intervertebral disc herniation is a condition in which the jelly-like center of a spinal disc pushes through a crack in the tough outer layer and puts pressure on the nerves near the spine.
Symptoms: back pain, leg pain, numbness or tingling in the legs or feet, muscle weakness, bowel or bladder problems
Treatments: rest and activity modification, physical therapy, medications, surgery

Description: Intestinal obstruction occurs when the small or large intestine is partially or completely blocked, leading to abdominal pain, bloating, vomiting, and constipation.
Symptoms: abdominal pain and cramping, bloating, vomiting, constipation
Treatments: surgery to remove the obstruction, medications to relieve symptoms, intravenous fluids and electrolytes

Description: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a common condition that affects the large intestine.
Symptoms: abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, constipation, mucus in the stool
Treatments: dietary changes, fiber supplements, medications to control bowel movements

Description: Ischemic heart disease is a condition where the heart muscle is not getting enough blood and oxygen due to a narrowing or blockage of the coronary arteries.
Symptoms: chest pain or discomfort, shortness of breath, fatigue, nausea
Treatments: lifestyle changes (e.g. exercise, healthy diet), medications to lower blood pressure and cholesterol, angioplasty or coronary artery bypass surgery

Description: Japanese encephalitis is a viral infection that is transmitted by mosquitoes and can cause inflammation of the brain.
Symptoms: fever, headache, vomiting, seizures, stiff neck, muscle weakness, confusion
Treatments: supportive care, antiviral medication, preventive vaccination

Description: Yellow staining of the skin and sclerae (the whites of the eyes) by abnormally high blood levels of the bile pigment bilirubin. The yellowing extends to other tissues and body fluids. Jaundice was once called the "morbus regius" (the regal disease) in the belief that only the touch of a king could cure it
Symptoms: yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes, dark urine, pale stools, fatigue, abdominal pain
Treatments: treating the underlying cause, phototherapy, exchange transfusion, medications

Description: Juvenile idiopathic arthritis is a type of arthritis that affects children under the age of 16. It causes joint pain, swelling, stiffness, and reduced mobility.
Symptoms: joint pain and swelling, stiffness, especially in the morning, limping, high fever, eye inflammation, rash
Treatments: medications to reduce inflammation and pain, physical therapy to maintain joint mobility and strength, occupational therapy to improve daily activities and quality of life

Description: Kawasaki disease is an illness that primarily affects children and can cause inflammation in the blood vessels throughout the body.
Symptoms: fever, red eyes, rash, swollen lymph nodes, swollen hands and feet, strawberry tongue
Treatments: intravenous immunoglobulin (ivig), aspirin, corticosteroids

Description: Kidney stones are hard deposits of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys.
Symptoms: severe pain in the side and back, below the ribs, pain that radiates to the lower abdomen and groin, painful urination, pink, red or brown urine, nausea and vomiting
Treatments: drinking water to help pass the stone, medications to relieve pain, surgery (in severe cases)

Description: Legionellosis is a type of pneumonia caused by the Legionella bacteria.
Symptoms: cough, fever, shortness of breath, muscle aches, headache, nausea and vomiting
Treatments: antibiotics, supportive care

Description: Leishmaniasis is a parasitic disease that is transmitted by the bite of infected sand flies.
Symptoms: skin sores, fever, weight loss, enlarged spleen and liver
Treatments: antiparasitic medication, wound care

Description: Leprosy is a chronic bacterial infection that can damage the skin, nerves, and other organs.
Symptoms: skin lesions, numbness or lack of sensation, muscle weakness, eye problems, nosebleeds
Treatments: multidrug therapy, surgery for deformities, rehabilitation

Description: Leptospirosis is an infection caused by bacteria of the Leptospira genus. It can cause a wide range of symptoms, from mild flu-like symptoms to severe disease involving multiple organs.
Symptoms: fever, headache, muscle aches, vomiting, jaundice, red eyes, abdominal pain, diarrhea, rash, chills
Treatments: antibiotics, supportive care

Description: Leukemia is a type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow, the spongy tissue inside bones where blood cells are made.
Symptoms: fatigue, fever, night sweats, easy bruising or bleeding, bone pain, enlarged lymph nodes, shortness of breath, pale skin, frequent infections, weight loss, headaches, dizziness, confusion, seizures
Treatments: chemotherapy, radiation therapy, stem cell transplant, targeted therapy, biological therapy

Description: Listeriosis is a serious infection caused by eating food contaminated with the bacterium Listeria monocytogenes. It can cause a variety of symptoms, from mild flu-like symptoms to severe disease involving the brain and other organs.
Symptoms: fever, muscle aches, nausea, diarrhea, headache, stiff neck, confusion, loss of balance, convulsions
Treatments: antibiotics, supportive care

Description: Liver cancer is a type of cancer that originates in the liver cells and can spread to other parts of the body.
Symptoms: abdominal pain and swelling, weight loss, loss of appetite, jaundice
Treatments: surgery to remove the cancer, chemotherapy, liver transplant

Description: Lou Gehrig's disease, also known as amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), is a progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, leading to muscle weakness, paralysis, and eventually respiratory failure.
Symptoms: muscle weakness in hands, arms, legs or feet, difficulty speaking, swallowing, or breathing, muscle cramps and twitching
Treatments: riluzole (rilutek), edaravone (radicava), physical therapy and occupational therapy, breathing support

Description: Lung cancer is a type of cancer that starts in the lungs and can spread to other parts of the body. It is often caused by smoking or exposure to harmful substances like radon or asbestos.
Symptoms: coughing up blood, chest pain, shortness of breath, hoarseness
Treatments: surgery to remove the cancer, chemotherapy, radiation therapy

Description: Lyme disease is an infection caused by the bacterium Borrelia burgdorferi. It is transmitted to humans through the bite of infected blacklegged ticks. The symptoms of Lyme disease can vary widely, from mild flu-like symptoms to severe disease involving the heart, joints, and nervous system.
Symptoms: fever, headache, fatigue, muscle aches, joint pain, swollen lymph nodes, "bulls-eye rash"
Treatments: antibiotics, pain relievers

Description: Lymphoma is a type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system, which is part of the body's immune system.
Symptoms: enlarged lymph nodes, fever, night sweats, weight loss, fatigue, itching, shortness of breath, chest pain, abdominal pain or swelling, nausea, vomiting, loss of appetite, headaches, confusion, seizures
Treatments: chemotherapy, radiation therapy, stem cell transplant, targeted therapy, biological therapy

Description: Macular degeneration is an eye disease that causes loss of vision in the center of the field of vision.
Symptoms: blurred vision, dark or empty areas in your central vision, difficulty reading or recognizing faces, distorted vision, straight lines appearing wavy, reduced central vision, need for brighter light when reading or doing close work, increased difficulty adapting to low light levels, decreased intensity or brightness of colors
Treatments: anti-vegf therapy, photodynamic therapy, laser therapy, vitamin supplements, low vision aids

Description: An infectious disease caused by protozoan parasites from the Plasmodium family that can be transmitted by the bite of the Anopheles mosquito or by a contaminated needle or transfusion. Falciparum malaria is the most deadly type.
Symptoms: fever, chills, headache, sweats, fatigue, nausea and vomiting, muscle pain, joint pain, anemia, convulsions
Treatments: antimalarial medications, supportive care

Description: Measles is a highly contagious viral disease that can be serious or even fatal. It is spread through the air by coughing or sneezing. The symptoms of measles include fever, cough, runny nose, and a rash all over the body.
Symptoms: fever, cough, runny nose, red, watery eyes, rash, small white spots with bluish-white centers inside the mouth, body aches
Treatments: symptom relief, supportive care

Description: Meningococcal disease is a bacterial infection that can cause meningitis and sepsis. It is caused by the bacterium Neisseria meningitidis and is spread through respiratory and throat secretions.
Symptoms: fever, headache, stiff neck, nausea and vomiting, sensitivity to light, confusion, rash
Treatments: antibiotics, intravenous fluids, oxygen therapy, supportive care

Description: Menopause is a natural biological process that marks the end of a woman's menstrual cycles.
Symptoms: irregular periods, hot flashes, night sweats, sleep problems, mood changes, weight gain and slowed metabolism, thinning hair and dry skin, loss of breast fullness, vaginal dryness, decreased sex drive, pain during sex, urinary incontinence, increased urination or urgency
Treatments: hormone therapy, low-dose antidepressants, gabapentin, clonidine, vaginal estrogen, vaginal moisturizers and lubricants

Description: MRSA is a type of staph infection that is resistant to many antibiotics. It can cause skin infections, pneumonia, and other infections. MRSA is spread through contact with contaminated surfaces or through skin-to-skin contact.
Symptoms: redness and swelling of the skin, painful skin lesions, fever, chills, chest pain, shortness of breath
Treatments: antibiotics, draining of abscesses, supportive care

Description: A migraine can cause severe throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation, usually on one side of the head. It's often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and extreme sensitivity to light and sound. Migraine attacks can last for hours to days, and the pain can be so severe that it interferes with your daily activities.
Symptoms: acidity,  indigestion,  headache,  blurred and distorted vision,  excessive hunger,  stiff neck,  depression,  irritability,  visual disturbances
Treatments: meditation, reduce stress, use poloroid glasses in sun, consult doctor

Description: Migraine headaches are a type of headache that typically cause intense throbbing pain in one area of the head, often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound. They can last for hours or days and can be disabling.
Symptoms: throbbing or pulsing pain on one side of the head, sensitivity to light and sound, nausea and vomiting, blurred vision, lightheadedness, fatigue, irritability
Treatments: pain-relieving medications such as aspirin or ibuprofen, triptans, which are medications specifically designed to treat migraines, preventive medications such as beta blockers or antidepressants, avoiding triggers such as certain foods, stress, and lack of sleep, resting in a quiet, dark room

Description: Mitral stenosis is a narrowing of the heart's mitral valve, which separates the upper and lower chambers of the left side of the heart. This narrowing restricts blood flow from the left atrium to the left ventricle, which can lead to a variety of symptoms and complications.
Symptoms: shortness of breath, fatigue, heart palpitations, chest pain, swelling in the legs or feet, coughing up blood
Treatments: medications to reduce fluid buildup, surgical repair or replacement of the mitral valve, lifestyle changes, such as maintaining a healthy weight and quitting smoking

Description: Mitral valve regurgitation is a condition in which the heart's mitral valve doesn't close tightly, allowing blood to flow backward into the heart's upper chamber. This can lead to a variety of symptoms and complications.
Symptoms: shortness of breath, fatigue, heart palpitations, swelling in the legs or feet, coughing up blood
Treatments: medications to control blood pressure and reduce fluid buildup, surgical repair or replacement of the mitral valve, lifestyle changes, such as maintaining a healthy weight and quitting smoking

Description: Molluscum contagiosum is a viral infection that causes small, raised, pearl-like bumps on the skin. It is spread through skin-to-skin contact and contact with contaminated objects.
Symptoms: small, raised bumps on the skin, white, waxy cores in the bumps, itching
Treatments: topical medications, cryotherapy, curettage, laser therapy

Description: Monkeypox is a rare viral disease that is similar to smallpox. It is spread through contact with infected animals or humans. Monkeypox can cause fever, rash, and pustules on the skin.
Symptoms: fever, headache, muscle aches, backache, swollen lymph nodes, chills, exhaustion, rash
Treatments: supportive care, antiviral medications

Description: Multiple myeloma is a type of cancer that affects plasma cells, which are white blood cells that produce antibodies to help fight infections. In multiple myeloma, abnormal plasma cells accumulate in the bone marrow and can crowd out healthy blood cells.
Symptoms: bone pain, especially in the back or ribs, weakness or fatigue, frequent infections, nausea or vomiting, constipation
Treatments: chemotherapy, stem cell transplant, radiation therapy, targeted therapy, immunotherapy

Description: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a chronic autoimmune disease of the central nervous system that affects the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerves.
Symptoms: fatigue, numbness or tingling in the limbs, muscle weakness or spasms, blurred or double vision, difficulty with coordination and balance, problems with speech and swallowing
Treatments: medications to slow the progression of the disease, physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, counseling or support groups

Description: Mumps is a viral infection that causes swelling of the salivary glands. It is spread through respiratory droplets and contact with contaminated surfaces. Mumps can also cause inflammation of the testicles, ovaries, and brain.
Symptoms: swelling of the salivary glands, fever, headache, muscle aches, fatigue, loss of appetite, painful testicles or breasts, stiff neck, difficulty swallowing
Treatments: supportive care, pain relievers, ice packs, fluids

Description: Muscular dystrophy is a group of genetic disorders that cause progressive weakness and degeneration of the muscles. Different types of muscular dystrophy have different patterns of inheritance and affect different muscles in the body.
Symptoms: muscle weakness, frequent falls, difficulty walking, muscle stiffness or rigidity, difficulty breathing
Treatments: physical therapy, respiratory therapy, orthopedic devices (e.g., braces, wheelchairs), medications to improve muscle strength or delay progression of the disease

Description: Myasthenia gravis is a neuromuscular disorder that causes muscle weakness and fatigue. It occurs when the immune system attacks the receptors that allow nerve impulses to reach the muscles, leading to difficulty controlling the affected muscles.
Symptoms: weakness in the muscles that control eye movement, double vision, difficulty speaking or swallowing, weakness in the arms, legs, or neck, difficulty breathing
Treatments: medications that suppress the immune system, medications that improve nerve function or increase muscle strength, plasmapheresis (a procedure that removes harmful antibodies from the blood), thymectomy (surgical removal of the thymus gland, which plays a role in the immune system)

Description: Mycobacterium avium complex (MAC) infection is a type of bacterial infection that commonly affects people with weakened immune systems, such as those with HIV/AIDS.
Symptoms: fever, fatigue, weight loss, night sweats, diarrhea, abdominal pain, persistent cough, shortness of breath
Treatments: antibiotics, antimicrobial therapy, immune system therapy

Description: Mycoplasma pneumonia is a type of bacterial pneumonia that affects the respiratory system.
Symptoms: fever, cough, sore throat, headache, fatigue, muscle aches, shortness of breath
Treatments: antibiotics, anti-inflammatory medications, rest and fluids

Description: Multiple myeloma is a type of cancer that affects plasma cells, a type of white blood cell. The cancerous plasma cells can build up in the bone marrow and form tumors in bones throughout the body. Myeloma can cause a variety of symptoms and complications.
Symptoms: bone pain, fatigue, increased susceptibility to infections, kidney damage, nausea and vomiting, unexplained weight loss
Treatments: chemotherapy, radiation therapy, stem cell transplant, medications to strengthen bones, pain management

Description: Myocardial infarction (MI), also known as a heart attack, occurs when blood flow to the heart muscle is blocked, usually by a blood clot. This can cause damage to the heart muscle and potentially be life-threatening.
Symptoms: chest pain or discomfort, shortness of breath, nausea or vomiting, feeling lightheaded or dizzy, sweating, pain or discomfort in the arms, back, neck, jaw, or stomach
Treatments: oxygen therapy, aspirin or other antiplatelet medications, thrombolytic therapy or percutaneous coronary intervention (pci) to restore blood flow, beta blockers, ace inhibitors, or other medications to prevent future heart attacks, lifestyle changes such as quitting smoking, eating a healthy diet, and getting regular exercise

Description: Narcolepsy is a neurological disorder that affects the sleep-wake cycle. It causes sudden and uncontrollable sleepiness during the day, as well as other symptoms such as cataplexy (loss of muscle control during strong emotions) and hallucinations during sleep or wakefulness.
Symptoms: excessive daytime sleepiness, sudden loss of muscle control (cataplexy), sleep paralysis (inability to move or speak when falling asleep or waking up), hallucinations during sleep or wakefulness, disrupted nighttime sleep
Treatments: stimulant medications to promote wakefulness, sodium oxybate (a medication that improves nighttime sleep and reduces daytime sleepiness), antidepressants or other medications to control cataplexy or hallucinations, lifestyle changes to improve sleep hygiene (e.g., avoiding caffeine and alcohol, establishing a regular sleep schedule)

Description: Nasal polyps are noncancerous growths that develop in the lining of the nose or sinuses.
Symptoms: stuffy or runny nose, postnasal drip, decreased sense of smell, facial pain or pressure, snoring
Treatments: nasal corticosteroids, nasal sprays, antihistamines, surgery

Description: Necrotizing fasciitis is a rare but serious bacterial infection that affects the soft tissue under the skin, including muscle and fat.
Symptoms: intense pain, swelling, redness, fever, nausea and vomiting, fatigue, ulcers or blisters, blackened or dead skin
Treatments: antibiotics, surgery to remove infected tissue, supportive care

Description: Neonatal tetanus is a type of tetanus that affects newborn babies. It is caused by exposure to the bacteria that produce tetanus toxin.
Symptoms: stiffness and spasms in the muscles, irritability, difficulty feeding, difficulty breathing, fever, sweating, high blood pressure, rapid heart rate
Treatments: antibiotics, tetanus immunoglobulin, supportive care

Description: Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma is a type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system, which is a part of the body's immune system. The cancerous cells can accumulate in the lymph nodes, bone marrow, and other organs, leading to a variety of symptoms and complications.
Symptoms: swollen lymph nodes, fatigue, night sweats, fever, unexplained weight loss, chest pain or pressure
Treatments: chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy, stem cell transplant, targeted therapy

Description: Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease is a condition in which excess fat is stored in the liver. It is not caused by alcohol abuse, and can range from simple fat accumulation to inflammation and cirrhosis.
Symptoms: fatigue, pain or discomfort in the upper right abdomen, swelling in the abdomen, elevated liver enzymes, insulin resistance and high blood sugar
Treatments: lifestyle changes such as weight loss, exercise, and a healthy diet, control of underlying conditions such as diabetes and high cholesterol, medications such as vitamin e, pioglitazone, and ursodeoxycholic acid

Description: Norovirus infection is a type of viral infection that affects the stomach and intestines. It is highly contagious and can spread easily in crowded places.
Symptoms: nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, stomach cramps, fever, headache, body aches
Treatments: rest and fluids, anti-nausea medication, rehydration therapy
